doesn't exist because we haven't captured it yet so our path to success under these
circumstances is we may not have the data but what we absolutely will have in the organization
is subject matter experts in that particular in that particular field so the
um the example that we're going to walk through the hypothetical example that we're going to walk through this afternoon is this idea of risk in some
in some assets so you're an organization you have a number of assets and you want to know what the actual risk is that you
have in terms of monetary value from these assets failing and let's say for example that you you
don't have you don't have that information so you you've never actually recorded what the failure rates are and

true because you must have subject matter experts in these assets somebody must build these assets for you somebody

things that they are doing doesn't mean to say that the inf that data is not actually
contained in their heads through years of experience so where we don't have actual ground
truth measured data we can use the subject matter experts within your organization in order to elicit that data and we'll

qualitative data so in that first box there we're going to ask them their opinion and then once

the previous example so how do we how do we use an
elicitation framework so we use an elicitation framework in this kind of following cycle starting there at the
kind of two o'clock position we gather our experts together and then we ask
them um some questions and i'll talk to you a bit in a minute about what those questions
are but we ask them some questions to elicit to elicit it to elicit
an individual answer to those questions and then as a group we discuss where we
have outliers so if somebody says that their opinion
is that a particular variable is going to lie around the um
50 mark for example and you have a few people in the group and some
might have said that that value could be as low as 20 or it could be as high as 80 so you've got some outliers there
what you want to do is to have a kind of group discussion to kind of reach a consensus and and bring those together
so you have that group discussion and then you go on to do the elicitation in that kind of group way so you kind of
then agree on what the actual figure is and then that agreement from the actual
group as a whole once you've discussed um where your disagreements are where the variances are and the reasons that some
people might think um some things vary more than than you do
at some point you're going to reach that agreement and from that agreement we're going to to create the data so that's
how the elicitation framework well that's how in general elicitation frameworks operate

what we do is we ask them to to write down their lower plausible limit for what we're going to call the quantity of

usually risk is usually defined by the likelihood of an asset failing

we tell the we tell our experts that you should judge it to be extremely unlikely
so if you could measure x it would be extremely unlikely that x would be below that not actually impossible but it

um lower band and then once you're happy that that is the case then as an individual you write
